page.title: 04Railways through Ilford
page.content: {Railways in South East Ilford: The railway line between Ilford and Romford, forming part of B.R.'s Eastern Region, has changed much during the last twenty years. {Goodmayes Station's}marshalling yard and coal depot has disappeared, the land being used today by a large DIY store, a freight depot and a school playing field. Both the{suburban}and{main lines}are electrified and trains carry anything from car bodies to commuters and from tourists to nucear waste through the area. {Fast passenger services}operate between Liverpool Street and the towns and resorts of East Anglia. Electrification and new rolling stock give a modern image allowing commuters to reach central London in less than half an hour. MAYFIELD HIGH SCHOOL
